q: Marjorie Dannenfelser , president of the Susan B. Anthony List, a group that opposes abortion said she trusts that Mike Pence has`` come to the place that's right for him and his family.'' What I most want is for him to have a long future, Marjorie Dannenfelser said.`` So I'm sure that he's made a discernment that this is the right move.'' '' committee's paperwork says he'll be seeking the 15th District seat. But he now lives in the 11th District again and is registered to vote there, according to 2010 campaign spokesman Bill Lockyer Maxfield. Obviously, no one knows what the outcome of redistricting will be, though there has been significant coverage of the idea that districts should reflect communities of interest, Maxfield said. Joe Simitian , meanwhile, filed a Statement of Intention to run in 2012 for the 21st Assembly District seat won in November by freshman lawmaker Rich Gordon , D-Menlo Park. Former Mike Pence David McIntosh said, I think his faith is first and foremost what makes him tick. Even as he approached this really hard decision( on running for office), I knew he was at peace about it because he was being prayerful and trying to discern what his calling was in public service. Bill Stephan, a friend of Mike Pence 's since their law school days, said Mike Pence was always clear on what he stood for and what he was passionate about.``

Bernie Sanders Welch to get the appropriate waivers and flexibility for us to go forward toward a single-payer system.'' Welch said, When Vermont innovates, the nation often follows our lead. Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way. Patrick Leahy said,`` While some in Washington are trying to turn the clock back on health reform, Vermont instead is moving forward.
